comments.commentBody:
What do volunteer elderberries do? As an elder only sporadically employed on a freelance basis, I've been looking into volunteer work, but most of the things in the areas that interest me are either stuffing envelopes, which is boring, or would wind up with me doing for free what I other wise get paid for, which is impractical.

Guarding a retaining wall is definitely not up my alley. I may have to go back to Plan A, which was volunteering at the animal shelter (but not during the summer, since I stay indoors in hot weather).

Little doubt that I am at least 1/1,000,000,000th Native American, or whatever fraction it takes to go back to our Ur-Ancestors from whom we all descend. Therefore I am delighted to be related to Ms. Warren; less so to have the Mittser in the family, not to mention that black sheep Cheney. Guess that's why they say you can't choose your relatives.

But perhaps we could talk about stuff that matters. Revenons a nos moutons?

Definition of a racist:
Vicious Ignoramus.

I watched a clip of Warren explaining what she did when she expounded about her 'heritage,'years ago and I wasn't very comfortable watching her.
She seemed evasive when she spoke about her attempt to be invited or included in Indian gatherings.
A little bit disingenuous for me.
Sorry Elizabeth, but we can't all get to be minorities no matter how hard we may try.
Cheers Duke

Why are Republicans so fixated on ancestry.  There is no proof that Warren received special consideration or any benefit, at all by claiming to be part Native American.  Apparently she has the requisite lineage to qualify as a Native American but how does this affect her performance as a law professor, consumer advocate or candidate?  What relevance does her ancestry add to her positions on health care reform, curbing banking abuses or protecting cosumers?  This is a supreme non-issue being raised to score some cynical advantage over a qualified candidate.

"This merits a reexamination of the difficult question of what it means to be Native."

What it means in this case is you're entitled to check a box that affords you preferences. Whatever your feelings about affirmative action, the fact that a white woman separated by many generations from her "native" blood and who did not suffer deprivation, prejudice or any other kind of harm due to her native blood should derive benefit because of it is obscene. And the fact that her benefit might have come at the cost of someone whose only failing was that he/she did not have a great-great-great grandmother of a favored race or ethnicity makes it even more obscene. Elizabeth Warren deserves every bit of the ridicule she is getting.
Okay, but if the blond hair pseudo Native American Warren didn't use this excuse to get into college, then a reall Native American could have gotten in.  Doesn't anyone care about that?

The human race orginated in East Africa as the first modern humans were very dark people.

Due to migration from Africa to differing parts of the world climate, environment and sunlight led to all of the very superficial differences that we see as race. It is all about Vitamin D prouduction, folate protection and gene protection from damaging solar radiation. It is also all about keeping warm or cool.

Only in America would this silliness continue. POTUS Obama is seen as all black even though by biology he is half white and by culture all white. Spain and France had a complex system of racial classification.So did apartheid South Africa and Nazi Germany. Eugenics was born in America.

Only in America do you have Hispanic/Latino which has nothing to do with race, color or nationality bumping up against African American in all of it's racial complexity reduced to one drop of black blood. Unlike most so called African Americans ,POTUS Obama actually knows the name/date of arrival/date of departure, tribe and country of his African ancestor.While many Americans claim Native American blood.

Walter White of the NAACP and Fulgenicio Batista of Cuba and Carol Channing and Eva Longoria are all black by American standards. They would have all been slaves during slavery and second class citizens during Jim Crow despite looking white.

My Republican friends relish the advantages offered them in tax loopholes and business subsidies.  This whole line of convoluted thinking regarding Elizabeth Warren is such an empty pretense normal people would be ashamed to be associated with it.  Of course, Scott Brown, his cronies and those defending this nonsense know no shame.

People: make no mistake. This not about Ms. Warren's ancestry. This is about Republicans hatred for minorities and what they consider their undeserved special treatment.

Whether Ms. Warren is 1/32 or 100% Native American is irrelevant. What matters to them is being able to point out, once again, how minorities have an advantage over the Christian white men who built this country without any help from anyone--remember that, in their minds, non-whites are lazy and stupid and that includesthose of us who happen to be of European ancestry but have last names with a little too many vowels in them.
If Warren were a Republican you would have written a column about what a lying scoundrel she was.

I was involved with  hiring decisions at the University of Wisconsin, Madison. Never once did I see anyone submit a "form" with a box to check for ethnicity. Every time we advertised for a position, we wold get 100s of vitas and writing samples. Finalists would get an interview and sometimes additional materials in the forms of book manuscripts or chapters wold be requested. the idea that anyone could "game" the system the way some of the commenters have suggested simply shows that they are completely unfamiliar with the way hiring takes pace at universities.

Leftists want to have their cake and eat it too. They want to set up a racial spoils system that ensures that Malia Obama will get into Harvard with an SAT score 400 points less than a penniless first-generation Burmese refugee who is turned away. Then they reserve the right to game the racist system they have set up whenever "one of our kind of people" need a well paid sinecure. What truly vile, selfish people.

Let us take this opportunity to uproot all racial spoils systems root and branch. Let's go forward as a nation of individuals, and to h3ll with all "affirmative action" racist bean counting.

George in MA, I don't think you read the article very carefully.

It's not an "unproven claim" that Elizabeth Warren is native American.

And she is an "authentic Native American", too.

The article points out how difficult it is to prove native descent, but apparently she has done it.

She can prove that she is 1/32 Cherokee, which is enough to make her a member of a Cherokee tribe. If this is good enough for the Cherokees, why isn't this good enough for you?

I'll bet you don't have any confidence in Hawaiian birth certificates, even long form, either.

No evidence that she ever "took pecuniary advantage" of anything or anyone.

This is just another Republican / Scott Brown scam to divert discussion from the real issues and stir up opposition to her based on false information and innuendo. We get this all the time from Republican campaigns. It's the Brown campaign that is "gaming the system".

Do an internet search on this: "Cities build there own broadband networks."

More local governments should start thing about the people and the heck with the carriers.

The US is 15th in fastest speeds and Europeans pay a fraction of what we pay. The UK government doesn't contribute anything to finance the network, and neither does the Netherlands where some people get up to 100 mbps in both directions as well as phone and T for under $100.00 per month.

This is all built with private funds, but the government thinks of the people first when they regulated service.

I am "half Jewish" - for religious Jews, I’ll tell you straight out, it's the "wrong half" (my father). OTOH it was PLENTY for me to experience enormous anti-Semitic prejudice growing up. Restricted housing, scalding slurs, club doors closed - all hurt. Worst tho was the shame. It was a dark family secret - sensed but nameless.

As most mixed know, for those who hate your "bad" part, it's always enough to reject you much as ink clouds water. Even if there’s but a micro-fraction black, you’re Black (and according to plenty of wacko laws too ).

All the more, if one "looks" like the ethnic/racial minority. My brothers and I DID "look Jewish" - enough so racists coughed out apologies when we were spotted after they'd recounted anti-Semitic "jokes". A WASP summer-camp room-mate discounted my story of being Episcopalian (how I was brought up and my line before "coming out."). After returning home, I switched my cross pendant for a Magen David, flooded with relief at ending the deceit.

Later in Israel, I learned self -identification wasn't enough for Orthodoxy. This infuriated me after so much suffering as a "Jew" (indeed, Israeli law recognizes this reality by granting citizenship for the same % "blood" as the infamous Nurenburg Laws).

This is but one way of explaining my POV; It's OK to identify oneself as any minority ON WHICH BASIS ONE SUFFERS DISCRIMINATION. We all need to feel free to accept our whole selves.

This is a tempest in a teapot and a manufactured controversy. Elizabeth Warren oozes integrity and decency. She's consistently advocated for fairness and transparency for over matched and under represented consumers against powerful and sophisticated financial and corporate interests. She's stood up for the vast majority of Americans and insisted they be treated fairly and their rights and responsibilities be clear and above board specifically in the area of consumer financial products.Meanwhile Scott Brown has been Wall Street's favorite senator. I daresay they've had plenty of advocates doing their bidding and seem to be doing just fine thank you.
It's your call Massachusetts. I only wish Elizabeth Warren were a Pennsylvanian...

There is plenty of blame to go around here.  It is wrong to use one's race to get special treatment.  It is wrong to demand that someone else prove his or her racial ancestry.  And it is especially wrong for an employer to give preferential treatment on the basis of race.  All this is true for politically correct and politically incorrect racial preferences.  Stop the bean-counting, stop the racial preferences.
This post is dismissive of the real issues in the case, which is whether Warren was honest in claiming minority status.
It's fustrating for me when truth is told most don't listen!
If Elizabeth Warren checked a box for Native American and did not also check a box for white, or European, or Caucasian, or whatever box would indicate her primary ethnicity, she was lying.

Last time I checked, lying on your resume is a pretty serious offense.  Unless, of course, if you're a Democrat. We live in a funny society, where bald-faced lying is a way of life, explained away by a fawning liberal press.  Bill Clinton got away with lying under oath, Obama lies every time he makes a speech, Warren lies on her Harvard application.  Why have we fallen so far as a society, where lying is not only excused, but held up as the new standard?  This is truly shameful.

Elizabeth Warren speaks for consumers. She is a principled, intelligent woman. When she was called before Issa and his crew to testify they were demeaning to her yet she remained polite. She would be a fine senator for Massachusetts.

Please Dr. Warren, pivot from this mean-spirited accusation to raise some serious economic challenges for Mr. Brown. It is ludicrous to presume that being a racial or ethnic minority in the U.S. provides economic advantages. Look at employment rates, average income, terms of financial loans, access to healthcare, arrest rates by race and show me the advantage.

Think about the underlying beliefs that claiming a minority identity gives an unfair advantage. Is there a belief that minorities are less qualified or less deserving or not real Americans? Does Mr. Brown et al., believe that a superior white guy was denied some privilege he was entitled to because Dr. Warren identified as Cherokee? What does he believe other minorities in Massachusetts deserve? Does he wish to cut student loans, unemployment benefits, programs to help domestic violence victims because "those people" are not equal to him? Or does he prefer our history of blacks counting as 3/5 of a person, women being denied voting rights and President Andrew Jackson's policy of Indian Removal.

I just wonder what did those people do to support Native American if they used their Native American status to their advantage. If they did not do anything, then I think they are despicable. For Elizabeth Warren, I wish she can tell us what did she do.

The Native American history in USA is one of the nobody-want-to-talk-about one that is totally opposite to the value this country holds so dear. Freedom? Democracy? Human right? None of then applied to Native American.
